Package Controller

Class MainMenu_Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.MainMenu_Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class MainMenu_Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller class for the Main Menu. Displays both a table of customers and a table of appointments. Takes the user to the add/edit appointment and customer pages, allows the user to delete customers and appointments, filters appointments by week and month, takes the user to the contact and customer schedule pages, takes the user to the appointment reports page. Allows the user to sign out of the application.

      • onActionViewCustomerAppointments

        void onActionViewCustomerAppointments​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Takes the user to the Customer Schedule page. Uses the customer that the user has selected from the main menu to display that customer's schedule.
        Parameters:
        event - The Customer Schedule button is clicked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onActionUpdateCustomer

        void onActionUpdateCustomer​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Takes the customer to the Edit Customer form. Uses the selected customer to load the Edit Customer form. Displays an error message if no customer is selected.
        Parameters:
        event - The Edit Customer button is clicked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onActionAddNewAppointment

        Parameters:
        event - The Add Appointment button is clicked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onActionUpdateAppointment

        void onActionUpdateAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Takes the customer to the Edit Appointment form. Uses the selected appointment to load the Edit Appointment form. Displays an error message if no appointment is selected.
        Parameters:
        event - The Edit Appointment button is clicked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onActionDeleteAppointment

        void onActionDeleteAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Deletes the selected appointment. Displays an error message if no appointment is selected. Displays a custom confirmation message to confirm delete. Displays a custom message after delete to let the user know the appointment has been deleted.
        Parameters:
        event - The Delete Appointment button is clicked.

      • onActionDeleteCustomer

        void onActionDeleteCustomer​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Deletes a customer from the database. Displays an error message if no customer is selected. Checks to see if a customer has any associated appointments before deleting and displays an error message if so. Displays a confirmation message for the user before deleting.
        Parameters:
        event - The Delete Customer button is clicked.

      • onActionFilterAppointments

        void onActionFilterAppointments​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Filters the appointment table by month or week. Radio buttons select either month or week to filter by and the date picker selects the starting date for the filter.
        Parameters:
        event - The Filter appointments button is clicked.

      • onActionResetTable

        void onActionResetTable​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Resets the appointment table view after filtering.
        Parameters:
        event - The Reset button is clicked.

      • onActionExitProgram

        void onActionExitProgram​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the user to the login page.
        Parameters:
        event - The Exit button is clicked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        LAMBDA EXPRESSION USAGE to initialize the Main Menu. A lambda expression is used to set the columns for both the customer and appointment tables. This simplifies the code by only typing the setCellValueFactor and PropertyValueFactory functions 1 time as opposed to typing them a total of 16 times between both tables.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url -
        resourceBundle -
